answers.answer: Hello,WBC or leukocytes in urine indicates infection in urine which can be due to recurrent urinary tract infection. Recurrent urine infections could be due to various reasons. Most common cause is stones in kidney which is blocking urine pathway. Other causes are changing sexual partners frequently, pregnancy, diabetes and of course childhood infections.The urine can also be due to retention of urine anywhere in its flow due t obstruction. The obstruction can be due to abnormality of structures since birth, stones or diseases like tumors in brain. Females are more prone to urine infections. So you should get a ultrasound, CT scan done and also some urine and blood tests.I hope it helps. Take care and regards.

question: I've been wondering what might cause leukocytes to be in the urine. I got a UTI home test, and it's showing there's trace amounts of leukocytes. The nitrates is negative, but I don't want to chance that I get another infection. I had one about a month ago, and it turned into pyelonephritis, requiring hospitalization due to extreme dehydration and vomiting. What are the reasons you might get WBC's in your urine?
title: Leukocytes in urine
